title: Blume High School
text:
The former Blume High School is a historic building in downtown <a href="Wapakoneta%2C%20Ohio">Wapakoneta, Ohio</a>, United States. Built in 1908 in a mix of architectural styles, it was designed by architects <a href="Frank%20Packard">Frank Packard</a> and W.M. Runkle. It was the first exclusive home of <a href="Wapakoneta%20High%20School">Wapakoneta High School</a>. Prior to that time, WHS was housed with other grades.
The original part of the high school was built at a cost of $41,315. In the mid-1920s, it was expanded with the construction of a <a href="gym">gym</a>nasium, a <a href="library">library</a>, and the "Red Brick Section" addition; while the last portion was built with money raised from <a href="Bond%20%28finance%29">bonds</a>, the library and gym were financed with a bequest from L.N. Blume.
Growth in the <a href="Wapakoneta%20City%20School%20District">Wapakoneta City School District</a> resulted in overcrowding by the mid-1950s. After a series of failed attempts, the school board succeeded in winning voter approval for the construction of a new school in 1956, and the new Wapakoneta High School building, which today serves as the Wapakoneta Middle School, opened at the beginning of 1959. Blume was converted into a <a href="middle%20school">junior high school</a> for several years, but a 1988 vote resulted in the school's closing by 1990.
In 1996, the former Blume High School was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> because of its architecture.
